common.api.user

Interface IUser

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote

    public interface IUser
extends java.rmi.Remote
    The interface that represents a single user on the network. An IUser object has a non-unique username. An IUser has the ability to accept an ADataPacket containing an IUserMsg (the specific IUserMsg is handled using a Visitor).
    Author:
    ChatApp Design Group E

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String BOUND_NAME
      The name the IUser object will be bound to in the RMI Registry.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void accept(UserDataPacket<? extends IUserMsg> message)
      Method that allows an IUser object to accept an incoming message and process it using a visitor.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the (non-unique) name of the user.
      void registerUser(IUser user)
      Method that tells this IUser to connect back to the sender IUser.

    • Field Detail

      • BOUND_NAME

        static final java.lang.String BOUND_NAME
        The name the IUser object will be bound to in the RMI Registry.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Gets the (non-unique) name of the user.

        Each user has a username that users will see. This name is NOT unique.

        Returns:
        name of the user
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - in case there's an error during network transmission

      • accept

        void accept(UserDataPacket<? extends IUserMsg> message)
     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method that allows an IUser object to accept an incoming message and process it using a visitor.
        Parameters:
        message - the incoming message to be sent to the user.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - in case an error occurs during network transmission

      • registerUser

        void registerUser(IUser user)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method that tells this IUser to connect back to the sender IUser.
        Parameters:
        user - the IUser stub to "connect" to.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - in case an error occurs during network transmission
